adjective.description: (of an action) convenient and practical although possibly improper or immoral.
examples: either side could break the agreement if it were expedient to do so

noun.description: A means of attaining an end, especially one that is convenient but considered improper or immoral.
examples: the current policy is a political expedient

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin expedient- extricating, putting in order, from the verb expedire (see expedite).
